selected_quotes: Evaluation of the new R-ISS for Multiple Myeloma risk stratification in 475 unselected patients
Evaluation of the Revised International Staging System in an independent cohort of unselected patients with Myeloma
Evaluation of the Revised ISSin an independent cohort of unselected patients with #multiplemyeloma
Evaluation of Revised International Staging Sys (R-ISS) in ind cohort of unselected pts w multiple #myeloma PubMed
Revised International Staging System (R-ISS) in an independent cohort of unselected patients with multiple myeloma

citation.abstract: The revised International Staging System (R-ISS) was recently introduced in order to improve risk stratification over the widely used ISS. R-ISS incorporates, in addition to ISS, the presence of chromosomal abnormalities detected by iFISH (t(4;14), t(14;16) and del17p) and elevated serum lactate dehydrogenase. R-ISS formulation was based on a large dataset of selected patients who had participated in clinical trials and has not been validated in an independent cohort of unselected patients. Thus, we evaluated R-ISS in 475 consecutive, unselected patients, treated in a single center. Our patients were older and had more often severe renal dysfunction than those of the original publication of R-ISS. Per R-ISS, 18% had R-ISS-1, 64.5% R-ISS-2 and 17.5% R-ISS-3. According to R-ISS, the 5-year survival rate was 77%, 53% and 19% for R-ISS-1, -2 and -3, respectively (p<0.001). R-ISS could identify three groups with distinct outcomes among patients treated with or without autologous stem cell transplantation, among those treated with either bortezomib-based or IMiD-based primary therapy and in patients ≤65, 66-75 or >75 years. However, in patients with severe renal dysfunction the distinction between groups was less clear. In conclusion, our data in consecutive, unselected patients, with differences in the characteristics and treatment approaches compared to the original International Myeloma Working Group (IMWG) cohort, verified that R-ISS is a robust tool for risk stratification of newly diagnosed patients with symptomatic myeloma.
citation.title: Evaluation of the Revised International Staging System (R-ISS) in an independent cohort of unselected patients with multiple myeloma
